oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Cragfont stairway
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interior view of Cragfont showing stairway detail. The open-well, open-string, half-turn staircase leads to the second floor landing. The staircase has a molded handrail, square balusters, a spiral handrail on the first floor, and ornamental stringer brackets. Two doorways with shouldered architrave trim are in the hall. The paneled, double doors to one room are open. The walls have wainscot panels on the lower half.

The late Georgian style home was built between 1798 and 1802, and was originally home of General James Winchester. It was named after the Rocky Bluff it is located on. Cragfont was occupied by the Winchester family until 1864.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jones, Lester
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Dwellings--Tennessee; Architecture, Domestic--Tennessee
Stairways; Passageways; Architraves; Stairhalls; Wainscoting; Doors & doorways
